segments.text: I see the water pouring over the edge of the sink, creating a huge puddle on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already wet, but she doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are sneaking cookies, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that stool, and it looks like it’s about to tip over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie like it’s the most normal thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how oblivious the woman is to everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin the cabinets if someone doesn’t turn it off soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall, and no one is going to catch him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone notices what’s happening before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just chaotic and sad.
segments.speaker: PAR
